enWisdom: Unrest (or acquisition [of property]) is accompanied by hardship
Continual strife is from the greatest tribulations
One of the greatest tribulations is the continuation of strife

Wisdom: وَالٍ ظَلُومٌ غَشُومٌ خَيْرٌ مِنْ فِتْنَةٍ تَدُومُ
enWisdom: An unjust and oppressive ruler is better than perpetual strife

Wisdom: سَفْكُ الدِّمَاءِ بِغَيْرِ حَقِّهَا يَدْعُو إِلَى حُلُولِ النِّقْمَةِ وَزَوَالِ النِّعْمَةِ
enWisdom: Spilling blood without just cause invites the descending of divine wrath and the cessation of blessings

Wisdom: قَدْ لَعَمْرِي يَهْلِكُ فِي لَهَبِ الْفِتْنَةِ الْمُؤْمِنُ وَيَسْلَمُ فِيهَا غَيْرُ الْمُسْلِمِ
enWisdom: I swear by my life that in the flames of unrest [that come after me], the believer will get destroyed while the non-Muslim shall remain safe

Wisdom: كُنْ فِي الْفِتْنَةِ كَابْنِ اللَّبُونِ لَا ضَرْعٌ فَيُحْلَبَ وَلَا ظَهْرٌ فَيُرْكَبَ
enWisdom: In times of unrest, be like an adolescent camel that has neither udders for milking nor a back strong enough for riding

Wisdom: مَنْ أَثَارَ كَامِنَ الشَّرِّ كَانَ فِيهِ عَطَبُهُ
enWisdom: One who provokes a latent evil, in it will be his own destruction

Wisdom: مَنْ شَبَّ نَارَ الْفِتْنَةِ كَانَ وَقُوداً لَهَا
enWisdom: One who ignites the fire of sedition will become fuel for it

Wisdom: لَا تَقْتَحِمُوا مَا اسْتَقْبَلْتُمْ مِنْ فَوْرِ الْفِتْنَةِ وَأَمِيطُوا عَنْ سَنَنِهَا [سُنَّتِهَا] وَخَلُّوا قَصْدَ السَّبِيلِ لَهَا
enWisdom: Do not plunge into the surge (or fire) of sedition that comes your way, and move away from its path while opening up the middle of the road for it [to pass]

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ كَالطَّاعِنِ نَفْسَهُ لِيَقْتُلَ رِدْفَهُ
enWisdom: Indeed you are just like the one who stabs himself in order to kill the one who is sitting behind him
